result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaquille T Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 123 days time served if revoked.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.  Complete an anger management program and follow any recommended treatment.  Complete any other programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department. Court set restitution at zero.

Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge (unless previously done.) - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; to be used at the Probation Department's discretion if there are any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaquille T Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing JULY 24, 2014 received and filed. (24 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION

Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS, with credit for 123 days time served if revoked.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 6 MONTHS "condition time" - STAYED; to be used at the Probation Department's discretion if there are any violations.
* Complete an anger management program and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Complete any other programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge (unless previously done.) - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court set restitution at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Shaquille T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a Bail/Bond Hearing.

Court addressed bail:  Defense's motion to modify bail to a signature bond argued and DENIED.  Bail remains as $1,000.00 cash with the same bail release conditions as previously ordered.

Parties are close to resolving this matter, however, need more time to work out the details.
Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Court CANCELLED the 07-28-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE FINAL PRETRIAL AND SPEEDY JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 2.

Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Speedy trial demand. Case adjourned for a Speedy Jury Trial and Final Pretrial in Branch 2.  Jury trial scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Shaquille T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-21-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Original PRELIMINARY HEARING Transcript (11 pages) commencing APRIL 3, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LORAINE B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in court with student intern Trish Fritz under the supervision of attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Shaquille T Johnson in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
